ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED.label: Enable Activity Stream
ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED.help_text: Enable capturing activity for the activity stream.

ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED_FOR_INVENTORY_SY.label: Enable Activity Stream for Inventory Sync
ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED_FOR_INVENTORY_SY.help_text: Enable capturing activity for the activity stream when running inventory sync.

ORG_ADMINS_CAN_SEE_ALL_USERS.label: All Users Visible to Organization Admins
ORG_ADMINS_CAN_SEE_ALL_USERS.help_text: Controls whether any Organization Admin can view all users and teams, even those not associated with their Organization.

MANAGE_ORGANIZATION_AUTH.label: Organization Admins Can Manage Users and Teams
MANAGE_ORGANIZATION_AUTH.help_text: Controls whether any Organization Admin has the privileges to create and manage users and teams. You may want to disable this ability if you are using an LDAP or SAML integration.

TOWER_URL_BASE.label: Base URL of the Tower host
TOWER_URL_BASE.help_text: This setting is used by services like notifications to render a valid url to the Tower host.

REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS.label: Remote Host Headers
REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS.help_text: HTTP headers and meta keys to search to determine remote host name or IP. Add additional items to this list, such as "HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR", if behind a reverse proxy. See the "Proxy Support" section of the Adminstrator guide for more details.

PROXY_IP_ALLOWED_LIST.label: Proxy IP Allowed List
PROXY_IP_ALLOWED_LIST.help_text: If Tower is behind a reverse proxy/load balancer, use this setting to configure the proxy IP addresses from which Tower should trust custom REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS header values. If this setting is an empty list (the default), the headers specified by REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS will be trusted unconditionally')

LICENSE.label: License
LICENSE.help_text: The license controls which features and functionality are enabled. Use /api/v2/config/ to update or change the license.

REDHAT_USERNAME.label: Red Hat customer username
REDHAT_USERNAME.help_text: This username is used to retrieve license information and to send Automation Analytics

REDHAT_PASSWORD.label: Red Hat customer password
REDHAT_PASSWORD.help_text: This password is used to retrieve license information and to send Automation Analytics

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_URL.label: Automation Analytics upload URL
AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_URL.help_text: This setting is used to to configure data collection for the Automation Analytics dashboard

INSTALL_UUID.label: Unique identifier for an AWX/Tower installation

CUSTOM_VENV_PATHS.label: Custom virtual environment paths
CUSTOM_VENV_PATHS.help_text: Paths where Tower will look for custom virtual environments (in addition to /var/lib/awx/venv/). Enter one path per line.

AD_HOC_COMMANDS.label: Ansible Modules Allowed for Ad Hoc Jobs
AD_HOC_COMMANDS.help_text: List of modules allowed to be used by ad-hoc jobs.

ALLOW_JINJA_IN_EXTRA_VARS.label: When can extra variables contain Jinja templates?
ALLOW_JINJA_IN_EXTRA_VARS.help_text: Ansible allows variable substitution via the Jinja2 templating language for --extra-vars. This poses a potential security risk where Tower users with the ability to specify extra vars at job launch time can use Jinja2 templates to run arbitrary Python.  It is recommended that this value be set to "template" or "never".

AWX_PROOT_ENABLED.label: Enable job isolation
AWX_PROOT_ENABLED.help_text: Isolates an Ansible job from protected parts of the system to prevent exposing sensitive information.

AWX_PROOT_BASE_PATH.label: Job execution path
AWX_PROOT_BASE_PATH.help_text: The directory in which Tower will create new temporary directories for job execution and isolation (such as credential files and custom inventory scripts).

AWX_PROOT_HIDE_PATHS.label: Paths to hide from isolated jobs
AWX_PROOT_HIDE_PATHS.help_text: Additional paths to hide from isolated processes. Enter one path per line.

AWX_PROOT_SHOW_PATHS.label: Paths to expose to isolated jobs
AWX_PROOT_SHOW_PATHS.help_text: List of paths that would otherwise be hidden to expose to isolated jobs. Enter one path per line.

AWX_ISOLATED_CHECK_INTERVAL.label: Isolated status check interval
AWX_ISOLATED_CHECK_INTERVAL.help_text: The number of seconds to sleep between status checks for jobs running on isolated instances.

AWX_ISOLATED_LAUNCH_TIMEOUT.label: Isolated launch timeout
AWX_ISOLATED_LAUNCH_TIMEOUT.help_text: The timeout (in seconds) for launching jobs on isolated instances.  This includes the time needed to copy source control files (playbooks) to the isolated instance.

AWX_ISOLATED_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT.label: Isolated connection timeout
AWX_ISOLATED_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT.help_text: Ansible SSH connection timeout (in seconds) to use when communicating with isolated instances. Value should be substantially greater than expected network latency.

AWX_ISOLATED_HOST_KEY_CHECKING.label: Isolated host key checking
AWX_ISOLATED_HOST_KEY_CHECKING.help_text: When set to True, AWX will enforce strict host key checking for communication with isolated nodes.

AWX_ISOLATED_KEY_GENERATION.label: Generate RSA keys for isolated instances
AWX_ISOLATED_KEY_GENERATION.help_text: If set, a random RSA key will be generated and distributed to isolated instances.  To disable this behavior and manage authentication for isolated instances outside of Tower, disable this setting.

AWX_ISOLATED_PRIVATE_KEY.label: The RSA private key for SSH traffic to isolated instances
AWX_ISOLATED_PRIVATE_KEY.help_text: The RSA private key for SSH traffic to isolated instances

AWX_ISOLATED_PUBLIC_KEY.label: The RSA public key for SSH traffic to isolated instances
AWX_ISOLATED_PUBLIC_KEY.help_text: The RSA public key for SSH traffic to isolated instances

AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_ENABLED.label: Enable detailed resource profiling on all playbook runs
AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_ENABLED.help_text: If set, detailed resource profiling data will be collected on all jobs. This data can be gathered with `sosreport`.

AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_CPU_POLL_INTERVAL.label: Interval (in seconds) between polls for cpu usage.
AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_CPU_POLL_INTERVAL.help_text: Interval (in seconds) between polls for cpu usage. Setting this lower than the default will affect playbook performance.

AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_MEMORY_POLL_INTER.label: Interval (in seconds) between polls for memory usage.
AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_MEMORY_POLL_INTER.help_text: Interval (in seconds) between polls for memory usage. Setting this lower than the default will affect playbook performance.

AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_PID_POLL_INTERVAL.label: Interval (in seconds) between polls for PID count.
AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_PID_POLL_INTERVAL.help_text: Interval (in seconds) between polls for PID count. Setting this lower than the default will affect playbook performance.

AWX_TASK_ENV.label: Extra Environment Variables
AWX_TASK_ENV.help_text: Additional environment variables set for playbook runs, inventory updates, project updates, and notification sending.

INSIGHTS_TRACKING_STATE.label: Gather data for Automation Analytics
INSIGHTS_TRACKING_STATE.help_text: Enables Tower to gather data on automation and send it to Red Hat.

PROJECT_UPDATE_VVV.label: Run Project Updates With Higher Verbosity
PROJECT_UPDATE_VVV.help_text: Adds the CLI -vvv flag to ansible-playbook runs of project_update.yml used for project updates.

AWX_ROLES_ENABLED.label: Enable Role Download
AWX_ROLES_ENABLED.help_text: Allows roles to be dynamically downloaded from a requirements.yml file for SCM projects.

AWX_COLLECTIONS_ENABLED.label: Enable Collection(s) Download
AWX_COLLECTIONS_ENABLED.help_text: Allows collections to be dynamically downloaded from a requirements.yml file for SCM projects.

AWX_SHOW_PLAYBOOK_LINKS.label: Follow symlinks
AWX_SHOW_PLAYBOOK_LINKS.help_text: Follow symbolic links when scanning for playbooks. Be aware that setting this to True can lead to infinite recursion if a link points to a parent directory of itself.

GALAXY_IGNORE_CERTS.label: Ignore Ansible Galaxy SSL Certificate Verification
GALAXY_IGNORE_CERTS.help_text: If set to true, certificate validation will not be done when installing content from any Galaxy server.

STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.label: Standard Output Maximum Display Size
STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.help_text: Maximum Size of Standard Output in bytes to display before requiring the output be downloaded.

EVENT_STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.label: Job Event Standard Output Maximum Display Size
EVENT_STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.help_text: Maximum Size of Standard Output in bytes to display for a single job or ad hoc command event. `stdout` will end with `â€¦` when truncated.

SCHEDULE_MAX_JOBS.label: Maximum Scheduled Jobs
SCHEDULE_MAX_JOBS.help_text: Maximum number of the same job template that can be waiting to run when launching from a schedule before no more are created.

AWX_ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS.label: Ansible Callback Plugins
AWX_ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS.help_text: List of paths to search for extra callback plugins to be used when running jobs. Enter one path per line.

DEFAULT_JOB_TIMEOUT.label: Default Job Timeout
DEFAULT_JOB_TIMEOUT.help_text: Maximum time in seconds to allow jobs to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual job template will override this.

DEFAULT_INVENTORY_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.label: Default Inventory Update Timeout
DEFAULT_INVENTORY_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.help_text: Maximum time in seconds to allow inventory updates to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual inventory source will override this.

DEFAULT_PROJECT_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.label: Default Project Update Timeout
DEFAULT_PROJECT_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.help_text: Maximum time in seconds to allow project updates to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual project will override this.

ANSIBLE_FACT_CACHE_TIMEOUT.label: Per-Host Ansible Fact Cache Timeout
ANSIBLE_FACT_CACHE_TIMEOUT.help_text: Maximum time, in seconds, that stored Ansible facts are considered valid since the last time they were modified. Only valid, non-stale, facts will be accessible by a playbook. Note, this does not influence the deletion of ansible_facts from the database. Use a value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed.

MAX_FORKS.label: Maximum number of forks per job
MAX_FORKS.help_text: Saving a Job Template with more than this number of forks will result in an error. When set to 0, no limit is applied.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_HOST.label: Logging Aggregator
LOG_AGGREGATOR_HOST.help_text: Hostname/IP where external logs will be sent to.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PORT.label: Logging Aggregator Port
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PORT.help_text: Port on Logging Aggregator to send logs to (if required and not provided in Logging Aggregator).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TYPE.label: Logging Aggregator Type
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TYPE.help_text: Format messages for the chosen log aggregator.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_USERNAME.label: Logging Aggregator Username
LOG_AGGREGATOR_USERNAME.help_text: Username for external log aggregator (if required; HTTP/s only).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PASSWORD.label: Logging Aggregator Password/Token
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PASSWORD.help_text: Password or authentication token for external log aggregator (if required; HTTP/s only).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_LOGGERS.label: Loggers Sending Data to Log Aggregator Form
LOG_AGGREGATOR_LOGGERS.help_text:
List of loggers that will send HTTP logs to the collector, these can include any or all of: 
awx - service logs
activity_stream - activity stream records
job_events - callback data from Ansible job events
system_tracking - facts gathered from scan jobs.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_INDIVIDUAL_FACTS.label: Log System Tracking Facts Individually
LOG_AGGREGATOR_INDIVIDUAL_FACTS.help_text: If set, system tracking facts will be sent for each package, service, or other item found in a scan, allowing for greater search query granularity. If unset, facts will be sent as a single dictionary, allowing for greater efficiency in fact processing.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_ENABLED.label: Enable External Logging
LOG_AGGREGATOR_ENABLED.help_text: Enable sending logs to external log aggregator.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TOWER_UUID.label: Cluster-wide Tower unique identifier.
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TOWER_UUID.help_text: Useful to uniquely identify Tower instances.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL.label: Logging Aggregator Protocol
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL.help_text: Protocol used to communicate with log aggregator.  HTTPS/HTTP assumes HTTPS unless http:// is explicitly used in the Logging Aggregator hostname.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TCP_TIMEOUT.label: TCP Connection Timeout
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TCP_TIMEOUT.help_text: Number of seconds for a TCP connection to external log aggregator to timeout. Applies to HTTPS and TCP log aggregator protocols.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_VERIFY_CERT.label: Enable/disable HTTPS certificate verification
LOG_AGGREGATOR_VERIFY_CERT.help_text: Flag to control enable/disable of certificate verification when LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL is "https". If enabled, Tower's log handler will verify certificate sent by external log aggregator before establishing connection.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_LEVEL.label: Logging Aggregator Level Threshold
LOG_AGGREGATOR_LEVEL.help_text: Level threshold used by log handler. Severities from lowest to highest are DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL. Messages less severe than the threshold will be ignored by log handler. (messages under category awx.anlytics ignore this setting)

LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_GB.label: Maximum disk persistance for external log aggregation (in GB)
LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_GB.help_text: Amount of data to store (in gigabytes) during an outage of the external log aggregator (defaults to 1). Equivalent to the rsyslogd queue.maxdiskspace setting.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.label: File system location for rsyslogd disk persistence
LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.help_text: Location to persist logs that should be retried after an outage of the external log aggregator (defaults to /var/lib/awx). Equivalent to the rsyslogd queue.spoolDirectory setting.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_RSYSLOGD_DEBUG.label: Enable rsyslogd debugging
LOG_AGGREGATOR_RSYSLOGD_DEBUG.help_text: Enabled high verbosity debugging for rsyslogd.  Useful for debugging connection issues for external log aggregation.

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_LAST_GATHER.label: Last gather date for Automation Analytics.

SESSION_COOKIE_AGE.label: Idle Time Force Log Out
SESSION_COOKIE_AGE.help_text: Number of seconds that a user is inactive before they will need to login again.

SESSIONS_PER_USER.label: Maximum number of simultaneous logged in sessions
SESSIONS_PER_USER.help_text: Maximum number of simultaneous logged in sessions a user may have. To disable enter -1.

AUTH_BASIC_ENABLED.label: Enable HTTP Basic Auth
AUTH_BASIC_ENABLED.help_text: Enable HTTP Basic Auth for the API Browser.

OAUTH2_PROVIDER.label: OAuth 2 Timeout Settings
OAUTH2_PROVIDER.help_text: Dictionary for customizing OAuth 2 timeouts, available items are `ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_SECONDS`, the duration of access tokens in the number of seconds, `AUTHORIZATION_CODE_EXPIRE_SECONDS`, the duration of authorization codes in the number of seconds, and `REFRESH_TOKEN_EXPIRE_SECONDS`, the duration of refresh tokens, after expired access tokens, in the number of seconds.

ALLOW_OAUTH2_FOR_EXTERNAL_USERS.label: Allow External Users to Create OAuth2 Tokens
ALLOW_OAUTH2_FOR_EXTERNAL_USERS.help_text: For security reasons, users from external auth providers (LDAP, SAML, SSO, Radius, and others) are not allowed to create OAuth2 tokens. To change this behavior, enable this setting. Existing tokens will not be deleted when this setting is toggled off.

LOGIN_REDIRECT_OVERRIDE.label: Login redirect override URL
LOGIN_REDIRECT_OVERRIDE.help_text: URL to which unauthorized users will be redirected to log in. If blank, users will be sent to the Tower login page.

PENDO_TRACKING_STATE.label: User Analytics Tracking State
PENDO_TRACKING_STATE.help_text: Enable or Disable User Analytics Tracking.

CUSTOM_LOGIN_INFO.label: Custom Login Info
CUSTOM_LOGIN_INFO.help_text: If needed, you can add specific information (such as a legal notice or a disclaimer) to a text box in the login modal using this setting. Any content added must be in plain text or an HTML fragment, as other markup languages are not supported.

CUSTOM_LOGO.label: Custom Logo
CUSTOM_LOGO.help_text: To set up a custom logo, provide a file that you create. For the custom logo to look its best, use a .png file with a transparent background. GIF, PNG and JPEG formats are supported.

MAX_UI_JOB_EVENTS.label: Max Job Events Retrieved by UI
MAX_UI_JOB_EVENTS.help_text: Maximum number of job events for the UI to retrieve within a single request.

UI_LIVE_UPDATES_ENABLED.label: Enable Live Updates in the UI
UI_LIVE_UPDATES_ENABLED.help_text: If disabled, the page will not refresh when events are received. Reloading the page will be required to get the latest details.

AUTHENTICATION_BACKENDS.label: Authentication Backends
AUTHENTICATION_BACKENDS.help_text: List of authentication backends that are enabled based on license features and other authentication settings.

SOCIAL_AUTH_ORGANIZATION_MAP.label: Social Auth Organization Map
SOCIAL_AUTH_ORGANIZATION_MAP.help_text:
Mapping to organization admins/users from social auth accounts. This setting
controls which users are placed into which Tower organizations based on their
username and email address. Configuration details are available in the Ansible
Tower documentation.

SOCIAL_AUTH_TEAM_MAP.label: Social Auth Team Map
SOCIAL_AUTH_TEAM_MAP.help_text:
Mapping of team members (users) from social auth accounts. Configuration
details are available in Tower documentation.

SOCIAL_AUTH_USER_FIELDS.label: Social Auth User Fields
SOCIAL_AUTH_USER_FIELDS.help_text: When set to an empty list `[]`, this setting prevents new user accounts from being created. Only users who have previously logged in using social auth or have a user account with a matching email address will be able to login.

AUTH_LDAP_SERVER_URI.label: LDAP Server URI
AUTH_LDAP_SERVER_URI.help_text: URI to connect to LDAP server, such as "ldap://ldap.example.com:389" (non-SSL) or "ldaps://ldap.example.com:636" (SSL). Multiple LDAP servers may be specified by separating with spaces or commas. LDAP authentication is disabled if this parameter is empty.

AUTH_LDAP_BIND_DN.label: LDAP Bind DN
AUTH_LDAP_BIND_DN.help_text: DN (Distinguished Name) of user to bind for all search queries. This is the system user account we will use to login to query LDAP for other user information. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for example syntax.

AUTH_LDAP_BIND_PASSWORD.label: LDAP Bind Password
AUTH_LDAP_BIND_PASSWORD.help_text: Password used to bind LDAP user account.

AUTH_LDAP_START_TLS.label: LDAP Start TLS
AUTH_LDAP_START_TLS.help_text: Whether to enable TLS when the LDAP connection is not using SSL.

AUTH_LDAP_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.label: LDAP Connection Options
AUTH_LDAP_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.help_text: Additional options to set for the LDAP connection.  LDAP referrals are disabled by default (to prevent certain LDAP queries from hanging with AD). Option names should be strings (e.g. "OPT_REFERRALS"). Refer to https://www.python-ldap.org/doc/html/ldap.html#options for possible options and values that can be set.

AUTH_LDAP_USER_SEARCH.label: LDAP User Search
AUTH_LDAP_USER_SEARCH.help_text: LDAP search query to find users.  Any user that matches the given pattern will be able to login to Tower.  The user should also be mapped into a Tower organization (as defined in the AUTH_LDAP_ORGANIZATION_MAP setting).  If multiple search queries need to be supported use of "LDAPUnion" is possible. See Tower documentation for details.

AUTH_LDAP_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.label: LDAP User DN Template
AUTH_LDAP_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.help_text: Alternative to user search, if user DNs are all of the same format. This approach is more efficient for user lookups than searching if it is usable in your organizational environment. If this setting has a value it will be used instead of AUTH_LDAP_USER_SEARCH.

AUTH_LDAP_USER_ATTR_MAP.label: LDAP User Attribute Map
AUTH_LDAP_USER_ATTR_MAP.help_text: Mapping of LDAP user schema to Tower API user attributes. The default setting is valid for ActiveDirectory but users with other LDAP configurations may need to change the values. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for additional details.

AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_SEARCH.label: LDAP Group Search
AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_SEARCH.help_text: Users are mapped to organizations based on their membership in LDAP groups. This setting defines the LDAP search query to find groups. Unlike the user search, group search does not support LDAPSearchUnion.

AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_TYPE.label: LDAP Group Type
AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_TYPE.help_text: The group type may need to be changed based on the type of the LDAP server.  Values are listed at: https://django-auth-ldap.readthedocs.io/en/stable/groups.html#types-of-groups

AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.label: LDAP Group Type Parameters
AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.help_text: Key value parameters to send the chosen group type init method.

AUTH_LDAP_REQUIRE_GROUP.label: LDAP Require Group
AUTH_LDAP_REQUIRE_GROUP.help_text: Group DN required to login. If specified, user must be a member of this group to login via LDAP. If not set, everyone in LDAP that matches the user search will be able to login via Tower. Only one require group is supported.

AUTH_LDAP_DENY_GROUP.label: LDAP Deny Group
AUTH_LDAP_DENY_GROUP.help_text: Group DN denied from login. If specified, user will not be allowed to login if a member of this group.  Only one deny group is supported.

AUTH_LDAP_USER_FLAGS_BY_GROUP.label: LDAP User Flags By Group
AUTH_LDAP_USER_FLAGS_BY_GROUP.help_text: Retrieve users from a given group. At this time, superuser and system auditors are the only groups supported. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for more detail.

AUTH_LDAP_ORGANIZATION_MAP.label: LDAP Organization Map
AUTH_LDAP_ORGANIZATION_MAP.help_text: Mapping between organization admins/users and LDAP groups. This controls which users are placed into which Tower organizations relative to their LDAP group memberships. Configuration details are available in the Ansible Tower documentation.

AUTH_LDAP_TEAM_MAP.label: LDAP Team Map
AUTH_LDAP_TEAM_MAP.help_text: Mapping between team members (users) and LDAP groups. Configuration details are available in the Ansible Tower documentation.

AUTH_LDAP_1_SERVER_URI.label: LDAP Server URI
AUTH_LDAP_1_SERVER_URI.help_text: URI to connect to LDAP server, such as "ldap://ldap.example.com:389" (non-SSL) or "ldaps://ldap.example.com:636" (SSL). Multiple LDAP servers may be specified by separating with spaces or commas. LDAP authentication is disabled if this parameter is empty.

AUTH_LDAP_1_BIND_DN.label: LDAP Bind DN
AUTH_LDAP_1_BIND_DN.help_text: DN (Distinguished Name) of user to bind for all search queries. This is the system user account we will use to login to query LDAP for other user information. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for example syntax.

AUTH_LDAP_1_BIND_PASSWORD.label: LDAP Bind Password
AUTH_LDAP_1_BIND_PASSWORD.help_text: Password used to bind LDAP user account.

AUTH_LDAP_1_START_TLS.label: LDAP Start TLS
AUTH_LDAP_1_START_TLS.help_text: Whether to enable TLS when the LDAP connection is not using SSL.

AUTH_LDAP_1_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.label: LDAP Connection Options
AUTH_LDAP_1_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.help_text: Additional options to set for the LDAP connection.  LDAP referrals are disabled by default (to prevent certain LDAP queries from hanging with AD). Option names should be strings (e.g. "OPT_REFERRALS"). Refer to https://www.python-ldap.org/doc/html/ldap.html#options for possible options and values that can be set.

AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_SEARCH.label: LDAP User Search
AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_SEARCH.help_text: LDAP search query to find users.  Any user that matches the given pattern will be able to login to Tower.  The user should also be mapped into a Tower organization (as defined in the AUTH_LDAP_ORGANIZATION_MAP setting).  If multiple search queries need to be supported use of "LDAPUnion" is possible. See Tower documentation for details.

AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.label: LDAP User DN Template
AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.help_text: Alternative to user search, if user DNs are all of the same format. This approach is more efficient for user lookups than searching if it is usable in your organizational environment. If this setting has a value it will be used instead of AUTH_LDAP_USER_SEARCH.

AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_ATTR_MAP.label: LDAP User Attribute Map
AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_ATTR_MAP.help_text: Mapping of LDAP user schema to Tower API user attributes. The default setting is valid for ActiveDirectory but users with other LDAP configurations may need to change the values. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for additional details.

AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_SEARCH.label: LDAP Group Search
AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_SEARCH.help_text: Users are mapped to organizations based on their membership in LDAP groups. This setting defines the LDAP search query to find groups. Unlike the user search, group search does not support LDAPSearchUnion.

AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_TYPE.label: LDAP Group Type
AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_TYPE.help_text: The group type may need to be changed based on the type of the LDAP server.  Values are listed at: https://django-auth-ldap.readthedocs.io/en/stable/groups.html#types-of-groups

AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.label: LDAP Group Type Parameters
AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.help_text: Key value parameters to send the chosen group type init method.

AUTH_LDAP_1_REQUIRE_GROUP.label: LDAP Require Group
AUTH_LDAP_1_REQUIRE_GROUP.help_text: Group DN required to login. If specified, user must be a member of this group to login via LDAP. If not set, everyone in LDAP that matches the user search will be able to login via Tower. Only one require group is supported.

AUTH_LDAP_1_DENY_GROUP.label: LDAP Deny Group
AUTH_LDAP_1_DENY_GROUP.help_text: Group DN denied from login. If specified, user will not be allowed to login if a member of this group.  Only one deny group is supported.

AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_FLAGS_BY_GROUP.label: LDAP User Flags By Group
AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_FLAGS_BY_GROUP.help_text: Retrieve users from a given group. At this time, superuser and system auditors are the only groups supported. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for more detail.

AUTH_LDAP_1_ORGANIZATION_MAP.label: LDAP Organization Map
AUTH_LDAP_1_ORGANIZATION_MAP.help_text: Mapping between organization admins/users and LDAP groups. This controls which users are placed into which Tower organizations relative to their LDAP group memberships. Configuration details are available in the Ansible Tower documentation.

AUTH_LDAP_1_TEAM_MAP.label: LDAP Team Map
AUTH_LDAP_1_TEAM_MAP.help_text: Mapping between team members (users) and LDAP groups. Configuration details are available in the Ansible Tower documentation.

AUTH_LDAP_2_SERVER_URI.label: LDAP Server URI
AUTH_LDAP_2_SERVER_URI.help_text: URI to connect to LDAP server, such as "ldap://ldap.example.com:389" (non-SSL) or "ldaps://ldap.example.com:636" (SSL). Multiple LDAP servers may be specified by separating with spaces or commas. LDAP authentication is disabled if this parameter is empty.

AUTH_LDAP_2_BIND_DN.label: LDAP Bind DN
AUTH_LDAP_2_BIND_DN.help_text: DN (Distinguished Name) of user to bind for all search queries. This is the system user account we will use to login to query LDAP for other user information. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for example syntax.

AUTH_LDAP_2_BIND_PASSWORD.label: LDAP Bind Password
AUTH_LDAP_2_BIND_PASSWORD.help_text: Password used to bind LDAP user account.

AUTH_LDAP_2_START_TLS.label: LDAP Start TLS
AUTH_LDAP_2_START_TLS.help_text: Whether to enable TLS when the LDAP connection is not using SSL.

AUTH_LDAP_2_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.label: LDAP Connection Options
AUTH_LDAP_2_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.help_text: Additional options to set for the LDAP connection.  LDAP referrals are disabled by default (to prevent certain LDAP queries from hanging with AD). Option names should be strings (e.g. "OPT_REFERRALS"). Refer to https://www.python-ldap.org/doc/html/ldap.html#options for possible options and values that can be set.

AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_SEARCH.label: LDAP User Search
AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_SEARCH.help_text: LDAP search query to find users.  Any user that matches the given pattern will be able to login to Tower.  The user should also be mapped into a Tower organization (as defined in the AUTH_LDAP_ORGANIZATION_MAP setting).  If multiple search queries need to be supported use of "LDAPUnion" is possible. See Tower documentation for details.

AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.label: LDAP User DN Template
AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.help_text: Alternative to user search, if user DNs are all of the same format. This approach is more efficient for user lookups than searching if it is usable in your organizational environment. If this setting has a value it will be used instead of AUTH_LDAP_USER_SEARCH.

AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_ATTR_MAP.label: LDAP User Attribute Map
AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_ATTR_MAP.help_text: Mapping of LDAP user schema to Tower API user attributes. The default setting is valid for ActiveDirectory but users with other LDAP configurations may need to change the values. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for additional details.

AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_SEARCH.label: LDAP Group Search
AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_SEARCH.help_text: Users are mapped to organizations based on their membership in LDAP groups. This setting defines the LDAP search query to find groups. Unlike the user search, group search does not support LDAPSearchUnion.

AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_TYPE.label: LDAP Group Type
AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_TYPE.help_text: The group type may need to be changed based on the type of the LDAP server.  Values are listed at: https://django-auth-ldap.readthedocs.io/en/stable/groups.html#types-of-groups

AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.label: LDAP Group Type Parameters
AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.help_text: Key value parameters to send the chosen group type init method.

AUTH_LDAP_2_REQUIRE_GROUP.label: LDAP Require Group
AUTH_LDAP_2_REQUIRE_GROUP.help_text: Group DN required to login. If specified, user must be a member of this group to login via LDAP. If not set, everyone in LDAP that matches the user search will be able to login via Tower. Only one require group is supported.

AUTH_LDAP_2_DENY_GROUP.label: LDAP Deny Group
AUTH_LDAP_2_DENY_GROUP.help_text: Group DN denied from login. If specified, user will not be allowed to login if a member of this group.  Only one deny group is supported.

AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_FLAGS_BY_GROUP.label: LDAP User Flags By Group
AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_FLAGS_BY_GROUP.help_text: Retrieve users from a given group. At this time, superuser and system auditors are the only groups supported. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for more detail.

AUTH_LDAP_2_ORGANIZATION_MAP.label: LDAP Organization Map
AUTH_LDAP_2_ORGANIZATION_MAP.help_text: Mapping between organization admins/users and LDAP groups. This controls which users are placed into which Tower organizations relative to their LDAP group memberships. Configuration details are available in the Ansible Tower documentation.

AUTH_LDAP_2_TEAM_MAP.label: LDAP Team Map
AUTH_LDAP_2_TEAM_MAP.help_text: Mapping between team members (users) and LDAP groups. Configuration details are available in the Ansible Tower documentation.

AUTH_LDAP_3_SERVER_URI.label: LDAP Server URI
AUTH_LDAP_3_SERVER_URI.help_text: URI to connect to LDAP server, such as "ldap://ldap.example.com:389" (non-SSL) or "ldaps://ldap.example.com:636" (SSL). Multiple LDAP servers may be specified by separating with spaces or commas. LDAP authentication is disabled if this parameter is empty.

AUTH_LDAP_3_BIND_DN.label: LDAP Bind DN
AUTH_LDAP_3_BIND_DN.help_text: DN (Distinguished Name) of user to bind for all search queries. This is the system user account we will use to login to query LDAP for other user information. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for example syntax.

AUTH_LDAP_3_BIND_PASSWORD.label: LDAP Bind Password
AUTH_LDAP_3_BIND_PASSWORD.help_text: Password used to bind LDAP user account.

AUTH_LDAP_3_START_TLS.label: LDAP Start TLS
AUTH_LDAP_3_START_TLS.help_text: Whether to enable TLS when the LDAP connection is not using SSL.

RADIUS_SERVER.help_text: Hostname/IP of RADIUS server. RADIUS authentication is disabled if this setting is empty.

RADIUS_SECRET.label: RADIUS Secret
RADIUS_SECRET.help_text: Shared secret for authenticating to RADIUS server.

TACACSPLUS_SECRET.label: TACACS+ Secret
TACACSPLUS_SECRET.help_text: Shared secret for authenticating to TACACS+ server.

TACACSPLUS_SESSION_TIMEOUT.label: TACACS+ Auth Session Timeout
TACACSPLUS_SESSION_TIMEOUT.help_text: TACACS+ session timeout value in seconds, 0 disables timeout.

TACACSPLUS_AUTH_PROTOCOL.label: TACACS+ Authentication Protocol
TACACSPLUS_AUTH_PROTOCOL.help_text: Choose the authentication protocol used by TACACS+ client.

SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_CALLBACK_URL.label: Google OAuth2 Callback URL
SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_CALLBACK_URL.help_text: Provide this URL as the callback URL for your application as part of your registration process. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for more detail.

SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_KEY.label: Google OAuth2 Key
SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_KEY.help_text: The OAuth2 key from your web application.

SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_SECRET.label: Google OAuth2 Secret
SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_SECRET.help_text: The OAuth2 secret from your web application.

SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_WHITELISTED_DO.label: Google OAuth2 Allowed Domains
SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_WHITELISTED_DO.help_text: Update this setting to restrict the domains who are allowed to login using Google OAuth2.

SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_AUTH_EXTRA_ARG.label: Google OAuth2 Extra Arguments
SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_AUTH_EXTRA_ARG.help_text: Extra arguments for Google OAuth2 login. You can restrict it to only allow a single domain to authenticate, even if the user is logged in with multple Google accounts. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for more detail.

SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_ORGANIZATION_M.label: Google OAuth2 Organization Map

username and email address. Configuration details are available in the Ansible
Tower documentation.

SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_TEAM_MAP.label: Google OAuth2 Team Map
SOCIAL_AUTH_GOOGLE_OAUTH2_TEAM_MAP.help_text:

SAML_AUTO_CREATE_OBJECTS.label: Automatically Create Organizations and Teams on SAML Login
SAML_AUTO_CREATE_OBJECTS.help_text: When enabled (the default), mapped Organizations and Teams will be created automatically on successful SAML login.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_CALLBACK_URL.label: SAML Assertion Consumer Service (ACS) URL
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_CALLBACK_URL.help_text: Register Tower as a service provider (SP) with each identity provider (IdP) you have configured. Provide your SP Entity ID and this ACS URL for your application.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_METADATA_URL.label: SAML Service Provider Metadata URL
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_METADATA_URL.help_text: If your identity provider (IdP) allows uploading an XML metadata file, you can download one from this URL.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SP_ENTITY_ID.label: SAML Service Provider Entity ID
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SP_ENTITY_ID.help_text: The application-defined unique identifier used as the audience of the SAML service provider (SP) configuration. This is usually the URL for Tower.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SP_PUBLIC_CERT.label: SAML Service Provider Public Certificate
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SP_PUBLIC_CERT.help_text: Create a keypair for Tower to use as a service provider (SP) and include the certificate content here.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SP_PRIVATE_KEY.label: SAML Service Provider Private Key
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SP_PRIVATE_KEY.help_text: Create a keypair for Tower to use as a service provider (SP) and include the private key content here.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ORG_INFO.label: SAML Service Provider Organization Info
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ORG_INFO.help_text: Provide the URL, display name, and the name of your app. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for example syntax.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_TECHNICAL_CONTACT.label: SAML Service Provider Technical Contact
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_TECHNICAL_CONTACT.help_text: Provide the name and email address of the technical contact for your service provider. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for example syntax.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SUPPORT_CONTACT.label: SAML Service Provider Support Contact
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SUPPORT_CONTACT.help_text: Provide the name and email address of the support contact for your service provider. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for example syntax.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ENABLED_IDPS.label: SAML Enabled Identity Providers
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ENABLED_IDPS.help_text: Configure the Entity ID, SSO URL and certificate for each identity provider (IdP) in use. Multiple SAML IdPs are supported. Some IdPs may provide user data using attribute names that differ from the default OIDs. Attribute names may be overridden for each IdP. Refer to the Ansible documentation for additional details and syntax.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SECURITY_CONFIG.label: SAML Security Config
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SECURITY_CONFIG.help_text: A dict of key value pairs that are passed to the underlying python-saml security setting https://github.com/onelogin/python-saml#settings

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SP_EXTRA.label: SAML Service Provider extra configuration data
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SP_EXTRA.help_text: A dict of key value pairs to be passed to the underlying python-saml Service Provider configuration setting.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_EXTRA_DATA.label: SAML IDP to extra_data attribute mapping
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_EXTRA_DATA.help_text: A list of tuples that maps IDP attributes to extra_attributes. Each attribute will be a list of values, even if only 1 value.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ORGANIZATION_MAP.label: SAML Organization Map
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ORGANIZATION_MAP.help_text:
Mapping to organization admins/users from social auth accounts. This setting
controls which users are placed into which Tower organizations based on their
username and email address. Configuration details are available in the Ansible
Tower documentation.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_TEAM_MAP.label: SAML Team Map
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_TEAM_MAP.help_text:
Mapping of team members (users) from social auth accounts. Configuration
details are available in Tower documentation.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ORGANIZATION_ATTR.label: SAML Organization Attribute Mapping
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ORGANIZATION_ATTR.help_text: Used to translate user organization membership into Tower.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_TEAM_ATTR.label: SAML Team Attribute Mapping
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_TEAM_ATTR.help_text: Used to translate user team membership into Tower.

NAMED_URL_FORMATS.label: Formats of all available named urls
NAMED_URL_FORMATS.help_text: Read-only list of key-value pairs that shows the standard format of all available named URLs.

NAMED_URL_GRAPH_NODES.label: List of all named url graph nodes.
NAMED_URL_GRAPH_NODES.help_text: Read-only list of key-value pairs that exposes named URL graph topology. Use this list to programmatically generate named URLs for resources

ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED.label: Enable Activity Stream
ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED.help_text: Enable capturing activity for the activity stream.

ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED_FOR_INVENTORY_SY.label: Enable Activity Stream for Inventory Sync
ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED_FOR_INVENTORY_SY.help_text: Enable capturing activity for the activity stream when running inventory sync.

ORG_ADMINS_CAN_SEE_ALL_USERS.label: All Users Visible to Organization Admins
ORG_ADMINS_CAN_SEE_ALL_USERS.help_text: Controls whether any Organization Admin can view all users and teams, even those not associated with their Organization.

MANAGE_ORGANIZATION_AUTH.label: Organization Admins Can Manage Users and Teams
MANAGE_ORGANIZATION_AUTH.help_text: Controls whether any Organization Admin has the privileges to create and manage users and teams. You may want to disable this ability if you are using an LDAP or SAML integration.

TOWER_URL_BASE.label: Base URL of the Tower host
TOWER_URL_BASE.help_text: This setting is used by services like notifications to render a valid url to the Tower host.

REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS.label: Remote Host Headers
REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS.help_text: HTTP headers and meta keys to search to determine remote host name or IP. Add additional items to this list, such as "HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR", if behind a reverse proxy. See the "Proxy Support" section of the Adminstrator guide for more details.

PROXY_IP_ALLOWED_LIST.label: Proxy IP Allowed List
PROXY_IP_ALLOWED_LIST.help_text: If Tower is behind a reverse proxy/load balancer, use this setting to configure the proxy IP addresses from which Tower should trust custom REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS header values. If this setting is an empty list (the default), the headers specified by REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS will be trusted unconditionally')

REDHAT_USERNAME.label: Red Hat customer username
REDHAT_USERNAME.help_text: This username is used to retrieve license information and to send Automation Analytics

REDHAT_PASSWORD.label: Red Hat customer password
REDHAT_PASSWORD.help_text: This password is used to retrieve license information and to send Automation Analytics

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_URL.label: Automation Analytics upload URL
AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_URL.help_text: This setting is used to to configure data collection for the Automation Analytics dashboard

CUSTOM_VENV_PATHS.label: Custom virtual environment paths
CUSTOM_VENV_PATHS.help_text: Paths where Tower will look for custom virtual environments (in addition to /var/lib/awx/venv/). Enter one path per line.

AD_HOC_COMMANDS.label: Ansible Modules Allowed for Ad Hoc Jobs
AD_HOC_COMMANDS.help_text: List of modules allowed to be used by ad-hoc jobs.

ALLOW_JINJA_IN_EXTRA_VARS.label: When can extra variables contain Jinja templates?
ALLOW_JINJA_IN_EXTRA_VARS.help_text: Ansible allows variable substitution via the Jinja2 templating language for --extra-vars. This poses a potential security risk where Tower users with the ability to specify extra vars at job launch time can use Jinja2 templates to run arbitrary Python.  It is recommended that this value be set to "template" or "never".

AWX_PROOT_ENABLED.label: Enable job isolation
AWX_PROOT_ENABLED.help_text: Isolates an Ansible job from protected parts of the system to prevent exposing sensitive information.

AWX_PROOT_BASE_PATH.label: Job execution path
AWX_PROOT_BASE_PATH.help_text: The directory in which Tower will create new temporary directories for job execution and isolation (such as credential files and custom inventory scripts).

AWX_PROOT_HIDE_PATHS.label: Paths to hide from isolated jobs
AWX_PROOT_HIDE_PATHS.help_text: Additional paths to hide from isolated processes. Enter one path per line.

AWX_PROOT_SHOW_PATHS.label: Paths to expose to isolated jobs
AWX_PROOT_SHOW_PATHS.help_text: List of paths that would otherwise be hidden to expose to isolated jobs. Enter one path per line.

AWX_ISOLATED_CHECK_INTERVAL.label: Isolated status check interval
AWX_ISOLATED_CHECK_INTERVAL.help_text: The number of seconds to sleep between status checks for jobs running on isolated instances.

AWX_ISOLATED_LAUNCH_TIMEOUT.label: Isolated launch timeout
AWX_ISOLATED_LAUNCH_TIMEOUT.help_text: The timeout (in seconds) for launching jobs on isolated instances.  This includes the time needed to copy source control files (playbooks) to the isolated instance.

AWX_ISOLATED_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT.label: Isolated connection timeout
AWX_ISOLATED_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT.help_text: Ansible SSH connection timeout (in seconds) to use when communicating with isolated instances. Value should be substantially greater than expected network latency.

AWX_ISOLATED_HOST_KEY_CHECKING.label: Isolated host key checking
AWX_ISOLATED_HOST_KEY_CHECKING.help_text: When set to True, AWX will enforce strict host key checking for communication with isolated nodes.

AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_ENABLED.label: Enable detailed resource profiling on all playbook runs
AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_ENABLED.help_text: If set, detailed resource profiling data will be collected on all jobs. This data can be gathered with `sosreport`.

AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_CPU_POLL_INTERVAL.label: Interval (in seconds) between polls for cpu usage.
AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_CPU_POLL_INTERVAL.help_text: Interval (in seconds) between polls for cpu usage. Setting this lower than the default will affect playbook performance.

AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_MEMORY_POLL_INTER.label: Interval (in seconds) between polls for memory usage.
AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_MEMORY_POLL_INTER.help_text: Interval (in seconds) between polls for memory usage. Setting this lower than the default will affect playbook performance.

AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_PID_POLL_INTERVAL.label: Interval (in seconds) between polls for PID count.
AWX_RESOURCE_PROFILING_PID_POLL_INTERVAL.help_text: Interval (in seconds) between polls for PID count. Setting this lower than the default will affect playbook performance.

AWX_TASK_ENV.label: Extra Environment Variables
AWX_TASK_ENV.help_text: Additional environment variables set for playbook runs, inventory updates, project updates, and notification sending.

INSIGHTS_TRACKING_STATE.label: Gather data for Automation Analytics
INSIGHTS_TRACKING_STATE.help_text: Enables Tower to gather data on automation and send it to Red Hat.

PROJECT_UPDATE_VVV.label: Run Project Updates With Higher Verbosity
PROJECT_UPDATE_VVV.help_text: Adds the CLI -vvv flag to ansible-playbook runs of project_update.yml used for project updates.

AWX_ROLES_ENABLED.label: Enable Role Download
AWX_ROLES_ENABLED.help_text: Allows roles to be dynamically downloaded from a requirements.yml file for SCM projects.

AWX_COLLECTIONS_ENABLED.label: Enable Collection(s) Download
AWX_COLLECTIONS_ENABLED.help_text: Allows collections to be dynamically downloaded from a requirements.yml file for SCM projects.

AWX_SHOW_PLAYBOOK_LINKS.label: Follow symlinks
AWX_SHOW_PLAYBOOK_LINKS.help_text: Follow symbolic links when scanning for playbooks. Be aware that setting this to True can lead to infinite recursion if a link points to a parent directory of itself.

GALAXY_IGNORE_CERTS.label: Ignore Ansible Galaxy SSL Certificate Verification
GALAXY_IGNORE_CERTS.help_text: If set to true, certificate validation will not be done when installing content from any Galaxy server.

STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.label: Standard Output Maximum Display Size
STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.help_text: Maximum Size of Standard Output in bytes to display before requiring the output be downloaded.

EVENT_STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.label: Job Event Standard Output Maximum Display Size
EVENT_STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.help_text: Maximum Size of Standard Output in bytes to display for a single job or ad hoc command event. `stdout` will end with `â€¦` when truncated.

SCHEDULE_MAX_JOBS.label: Maximum Scheduled Jobs
SCHEDULE_MAX_JOBS.help_text: Maximum number of the same job template that can be waiting to run when launching from a schedule before no more are created.

AWX_ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS.label: Ansible Callback Plugins
AWX_ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS.help_text: List of paths to search for extra callback plugins to be used when running jobs. Enter one path per line.

DEFAULT_JOB_TIMEOUT.label: Default Job Timeout
DEFAULT_JOB_TIMEOUT.help_text: Maximum time in seconds to allow jobs to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual job template will override this.

DEFAULT_INVENTORY_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.label: Default Inventory Update Timeout
DEFAULT_INVENTORY_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.help_text: Maximum time in seconds to allow inventory updates to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual inventory source will override this.

DEFAULT_PROJECT_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.label: Default Project Update Timeout
DEFAULT_PROJECT_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.help_text: Maximum time in seconds to allow project updates to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual project will override this.

ANSIBLE_FACT_CACHE_TIMEOUT.label: Per-Host Ansible Fact Cache Timeout
ANSIBLE_FACT_CACHE_TIMEOUT.help_text: Maximum time, in seconds, that stored Ansible facts are considered valid since the last time they were modified. Only valid, non-stale, facts will be accessible by a playbook. Note, this does not influence the deletion of ansible_facts from the database. Use a value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed.

MAX_FORKS.label: Maximum number of forks per job
MAX_FORKS.help_text: Saving a Job Template with more than this number of forks will result in an error. When set to 0, no limit is applied.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_HOST.label: Logging Aggregator
LOG_AGGREGATOR_HOST.help_text: Hostname/IP where external logs will be sent to.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PORT.label: Logging Aggregator Port
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PORT.help_text: Port on Logging Aggregator to send logs to (if required and not provided in Logging Aggregator).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TYPE.label: Logging Aggregator Type
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TYPE.help_text: Format messages for the chosen log aggregator.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_USERNAME.label: Logging Aggregator Username
LOG_AGGREGATOR_USERNAME.help_text: Username for external log aggregator (if required; HTTP/s only).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PASSWORD.label: Logging Aggregator Password/Token
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PASSWORD.help_text: Password or authentication token for external log aggregator (if required; HTTP/s only).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_LOGGERS.label: Loggers Sending Data to Log Aggregator Form
LOG_AGGREGATOR_LOGGERS.help_text:
List of loggers that will send HTTP logs to the collector, these can include any or all of: 
awx - service logs
activity_stream - activity stream records
job_events - callback data from Ansible job events
system_tracking - facts gathered from scan jobs.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_INDIVIDUAL_FACTS.label: Log System Tracking Facts Individually
LOG_AGGREGATOR_INDIVIDUAL_FACTS.help_text: If set, system tracking facts will be sent for each package, service, or other item found in a scan, allowing for greater search query granularity. If unset, facts will be sent as a single dictionary, allowing for greater efficiency in fact processing.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_ENABLED.label: Enable External Logging
LOG_AGGREGATOR_ENABLED.help_text: Enable sending logs to external log aggregator.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TOWER_UUID.label: Cluster-wide Tower unique identifier.
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TOWER_UUID.help_text: Useful to uniquely identify Tower instances.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL.label: Logging Aggregator Protocol
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL.help_text: Protocol used to communicate with log aggregator.  HTTPS/HTTP assumes HTTPS unless http:// is explicitly used in the Logging Aggregator hostname.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TCP_TIMEOUT.label: TCP Connection Timeout
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TCP_TIMEOUT.help_text: Number of seconds for a TCP connection to external log aggregator to timeout. Applies to HTTPS and TCP log aggregator protocols.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_VERIFY_CERT.label: Enable/disable HTTPS certificate verification
LOG_AGGREGATOR_VERIFY_CERT.help_text: Flag to control enable/disable of certificate verification when LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL is "https". If enabled, Tower's log handler will verify certificate sent by external log aggregator before establishing connection.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_LEVEL.label: Logging Aggregator Level Threshold
LOG_AGGREGATOR_LEVEL.help_text: Level threshold used by log handler. Severities from lowest to highest are DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL. Messages less severe than the threshold will be ignored by log handler. (messages under category awx.anlytics ignore this setting)

LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_GB.label: Maximum disk persistance for external log aggregation (in GB)
LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_GB.help_text: Amount of data to store (in gigabytes) during an outage of the external log aggregator (defaults to 1). Equivalent to the rsyslogd queue.maxdiskspace setting.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.label: File system location for rsyslogd disk persistence
LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.help_text: Location to persist logs that should be retried after an outage of the external log aggregator (defaults to /var/lib/awx). Equivalent to the rsyslogd queue.spoolDirectory setting.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_RSYSLOGD_DEBUG.label: Enable rsyslogd debugging
LOG_AGGREGATOR_RSYSLOGD_DEBUG.help_text: Enabled high verbosity debugging for rsyslogd.  Useful for debugging connection issues for external log aggregation.

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_LAST_GATHER.label: Last gather date for Automation Analytics.

SESSION_COOKIE_AGE.label: Idle Time Force Log Out
SESSION_COOKIE_AGE.help_text: Number of seconds that a user is inactive before they will need to login again.

SESSIONS_PER_USER.label: Maximum number of simultaneous logged in sessions
SESSIONS_PER_USER.help_text: Maximum number of simultaneous logged in sessions a user may have. To disable enter -1.

AUTH_BASIC_ENABLED.label: Enable HTTP Basic Auth
AUTH_BASIC_ENABLED.help_text: Enable HTTP Basic Auth for the API Browser.

OAUTH2_PROVIDER.label: OAuth 2 Timeout Settings
OAUTH2_PROVIDER.help_text: Dictionary for customizing OAuth 2 timeouts, available items are `ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_SECONDS`, the duration of access tokens in the number of seconds, `AUTHORIZATION_CODE_EXPIRE_SECONDS`, the duration of authorization codes in the number of seconds, and `REFRESH_TOKEN_EXPIRE_SECONDS`, the duration of refresh tokens, after expired access tokens, in the number of seconds.

ALLOW_OAUTH2_FOR_EXTERNAL_USERS.label: Allow External Users to Create OAuth2 Tokens
ALLOW_OAUTH2_FOR_EXTERNAL_USERS.help_text: For security reasons, users from external auth providers (LDAP, SAML, SSO, Radius, and others) are not allowed to create OAuth2 tokens. To change this behavior, enable this setting. Existing tokens will not be deleted when this setting is toggled off.

LOGIN_REDIRECT_OVERRIDE.label: Login redirect override URL
LOGIN_REDIRECT_OVERRIDE.help_text: URL to which unauthorized users will be redirected to log in. If blank, users will be sent to the Tower login page.

CUSTOM_LOGIN_INFO.label: Custom Login Info
CUSTOM_LOGIN_INFO.help_text: If needed, you can add specific information (such as a legal notice or a disclaimer) to a text box in the login modal using this setting. Any content added must be in plain text or an HTML fragment, as other markup languages are not supported.

CUSTOM_LOGO.label: Custom Logo
CUSTOM_LOGO.help_text: To set up a custom logo, provide a file that you create. For the custom logo to look its best, use a .png file with a transparent background. GIF, PNG and JPEG formats are supported.

MAX_UI_JOB_EVENTS.label: Max Job Events Retrieved by UI
MAX_UI_JOB_EVENTS.help_text: Maximum number of job events for the UI to retrieve within a single request.

UI_LIVE_UPDATES_ENABLED.label: Enable Live Updates in the UI
UI_LIVE_UPDATES_ENABLED.help_text: If disabled, the page will not refresh when events are received. Reloading the page will be required to get the latest details.

SOCIAL_AUTH_ORGANIZATION_MAP.label: Social Auth Organization Map
SOCIAL_AUTH_ORGANIZATION_MAP.help_text:
Mapping to organization admins/users from social auth accounts. This setting
controls which users are placed into which Tower organizations based on their
username and email address. Configuration details are available in the Ansible
Tower documentation.

SOCIAL_AUTH_TEAM_MAP.label: Social Auth Team Map
SOCIAL_AUTH_TEAM_MAP.help_text:
Mapping of team members (users) from social auth accounts. Configuration
details are available in Tower documentation.

SOCIAL_AUTH_USER_FIELDS.label: Social Auth User Fields
SOCIAL_AUTH_USER_FIELDS.help_text: When set to an empty list `[]`, this setting prevents new user accounts from being created. Only users who have previously logged in using social auth or have a user account with a matching email address will be able to login.

AUTH_LDAP_SERVER_URI.label: LDAP Server URI
AUTH_LDAP_SERVER_URI.help_text: URI to connect to LDAP server, such as "ldap://ldap.example.com:389" (non-SSL) or "ldaps://ldap.example.com:636" (SSL). Multiple LDAP servers may be specified by separating with spaces or commas. LDAP authentication is disabled if this parameter is empty.

AUTH_LDAP_BIND_DN.label: LDAP Bind DN
AUTH_LDAP_BIND_DN.help_text: DN (Distinguished Name) of user to bind for all search queries. This is the system user account we will use to login to query LDAP for other user information. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for example syntax.

AUTH_LDAP_BIND_PASSWORD.label: LDAP Bind Password
AUTH_LDAP_BIND_PASSWORD.help_text: Password used to bind LDAP user account.

AUTH_LDAP_START_TLS.label: LDAP Start TLS
AUTH_LDAP_START_TLS.help_text: Whether to enable TLS when the LDAP connection is not using SSL.

AUTH_LDAP_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.label: LDAP Connection Options
AUTH_LDAP_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.help_text: Additional options to set for the LDAP connection.  LDAP referrals are disabled by default (to prevent certain LDAP queries from hanging with AD). Option names should be strings (e.g. "OPT_REFERRALS"). Refer to https://www.python-ldap.org/doc/html/ldap.html#options for possible options and values that can be set.

AUTH_LDAP_USER_SEARCH.label: LDAP User Search
AUTH_LDAP_USER_SEARCH.help_text: LDAP search query to find users.  Any user that matches the given pattern will be able to login to Tower.  The user should also be mapped into a Tower organization (as defined in the AUTH_LDAP_ORGANIZATION_MAP setting).  If multiple search queries need to be supported use of "LDAPUnion" is possible. See Tower documentation for details.

AUTH_LDAP_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.label: LDAP User DN Template
AUTH_LDAP_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.help_text: Alternative to user search, if user DNs are all of the same format. This approach is more efficient for user lookups than searching if it is usable in your organizational environment. If this setting has a value it will be used instead of AUTH_LDAP_USER_SEARCH.

AUTH_LDAP_USER_ATTR_MAP.label: LDAP User Attribute Map
AUTH_LDAP_USER_ATTR_MAP.help_text: Mapping of LDAP user schema to Tower API user attributes. The default setting is valid for ActiveDirectory but users with other LDAP configurations may need to change the values. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for additional details.

AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_SEARCH.label: LDAP Group Search
AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_SEARCH.help_text: Users are mapped to organizations based on their membership in LDAP groups. This setting defines the LDAP search query to find groups. Unlike the user search, group search does not support LDAPSearchUnion.

AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_TYPE.label: LDAP Group Type
AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_TYPE.help_text: The group type may need to be changed based on the type of the LDAP server.  Values are listed at: https://django-auth-ldap.readthedocs.io/en/stable/groups.html#types-of-groups

AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.label: LDAP Group Type Parameters
AUTH_LDAP_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.help_text: Key value parameters to send the chosen group type init method.

AUTH_LDAP_REQUIRE_GROUP.label: LDAP Require Group
AUTH_LDAP_REQUIRE_GROUP.help_text: Group DN required to login. If specified, user must be a member of this group to login via LDAP. If not set, everyone in LDAP that matches the user search will be able to login via Tower. Only one require group is supported.

AUTH_LDAP_DENY_GROUP.label: LDAP Deny Group
AUTH_LDAP_DENY_GROUP.help_text: Group DN denied from login. If specified, user will not be allowed to login if a member of this group.  Only one deny group is supported.

AUTH_LDAP_USER_FLAGS_BY_GROUP.label: LDAP User Flags By Group
AUTH_LDAP_USER_FLAGS_BY_GROUP.help_text: Retrieve users from a given group. At this time, superuser and system auditors are the only groups supported. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for more detail.

AUTH_LDAP_ORGANIZATION_MAP.label: LDAP Organization Map
AUTH_LDAP_ORGANIZATION_MAP.help_text: Mapping between organization admins/users and LDAP groups. This controls which users are placed into which Tower organizations relative to their LDAP group memberships. Configuration details are available in the Ansible Tower documentation.

AUTH_LDAP_TEAM_MAP.label: LDAP Team Map
AUTH_LDAP_TEAM_MAP.help_text: Mapping between team members (users) and LDAP groups. Configuration details are available in the Ansible Tower documentation.

AUTH_LDAP_1_SERVER_URI.label: LDAP Server URI
AUTH_LDAP_1_SERVER_URI.help_text: URI to connect to LDAP server, such as "ldap://ldap.example.com:389" (non-SSL) or "ldaps://ldap.example.com:636" (SSL). Multiple LDAP servers may be specified by separating with spaces or commas. LDAP authentication is disabled if this parameter is empty.

AUTH_LDAP_1_BIND_DN.label: LDAP Bind DN
AUTH_LDAP_1_BIND_DN.help_text: DN (Distinguished Name) of user to bind for all search queries. This is the system user account we will use to login to query LDAP for other user information. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for example syntax.

AUTH_LDAP_1_BIND_PASSWORD.label: LDAP Bind Password
AUTH_LDAP_1_BIND_PASSWORD.help_text: Password used to bind LDAP user account.

AUTH_LDAP_1_START_TLS.label: LDAP Start TLS
AUTH_LDAP_1_START_TLS.help_text: Whether to enable TLS when the LDAP connection is not using SSL.

AUTH_LDAP_1_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.label: LDAP Connection Options
AUTH_LDAP_1_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.help_text: Additional options to set for the LDAP connection.  LDAP referrals are disabled by default (to prevent certain LDAP queries from hanging with AD). Option names should be strings (e.g. "OPT_REFERRALS"). Refer to https://www.python-ldap.org/doc/html/ldap.html#options for possible options and values that can be set.

AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_SEARCH.label: LDAP User Search
AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_SEARCH.help_text: LDAP search query to find users.  Any user that matches the given pattern will be able to login to Tower.  The user should also be mapped into a Tower organization (as defined in the AUTH_LDAP_ORGANIZATION_MAP setting).  If multiple search queries need to be supported use of "LDAPUnion" is possible. See Tower documentation for details.

AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.label: LDAP User DN Template
AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.help_text: Alternative to user search, if user DNs are all of the same format. This approach is more efficient for user lookups than searching if it is usable in your organizational environment. If this setting has a value it will be used instead of AUTH_LDAP_USER_SEARCH.

AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_ATTR_MAP.label: LDAP User Attribute Map
AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_ATTR_MAP.help_text: Mapping of LDAP user schema to Tower API user attributes. The default setting is valid for ActiveDirectory but users with other LDAP configurations may need to change the values. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for additional details.

AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_SEARCH.label: LDAP Group Search
AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_SEARCH.help_text: Users are mapped to organizations based on their membership in LDAP groups. This setting defines the LDAP search query to find groups. Unlike the user search, group search does not support LDAPSearchUnion.

AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_TYPE.label: LDAP Group Type
AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_TYPE.help_text: The group type may need to be changed based on the type of the LDAP server.  Values are listed at: https://django-auth-ldap.readthedocs.io/en/stable/groups.html#types-of-groups

AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.label: LDAP Group Type Parameters
AUTH_LDAP_1_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.help_text: Key value parameters to send the chosen group type init method.

AUTH_LDAP_1_REQUIRE_GROUP.label: LDAP Require Group
AUTH_LDAP_1_REQUIRE_GROUP.help_text: Group DN required to login. If specified, user must be a member of this group to login via LDAP. If not set, everyone in LDAP that matches the user search will be able to login via Tower. Only one require group is supported.

AUTH_LDAP_1_DENY_GROUP.label: LDAP Deny Group
AUTH_LDAP_1_DENY_GROUP.help_text: Group DN denied from login. If specified, user will not be allowed to login if a member of this group.  Only one deny group is supported.

AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_FLAGS_BY_GROUP.label: LDAP User Flags By Group
AUTH_LDAP_1_USER_FLAGS_BY_GROUP.help_text: Retrieve users from a given group. At this time, superuser and system auditors are the only groups supported. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for more detail.

AUTH_LDAP_1_ORGANIZATION_MAP.label: LDAP Organization Map
AUTH_LDAP_1_ORGANIZATION_MAP.help_text: Mapping between organization admins/users and LDAP groups. This controls which users are placed into which Tower organizations relative to their LDAP group memberships. Configuration details are available in the Ansible Tower documentation.

AUTH_LDAP_1_TEAM_MAP.label: LDAP Team Map
AUTH_LDAP_1_TEAM_MAP.help_text: Mapping between team members (users) and LDAP groups. Configuration details are available in the Ansible Tower documentation.

AUTH_LDAP_2_SERVER_URI.label: LDAP Server URI
AUTH_LDAP_2_SERVER_URI.help_text: URI to connect to LDAP server, such as "ldap://ldap.example.com:389" (non-SSL) or "ldaps://ldap.example.com:636" (SSL). Multiple LDAP servers may be specified by separating with spaces or commas. LDAP authentication is disabled if this parameter is empty.

AUTH_LDAP_2_BIND_DN.label: LDAP Bind DN
AUTH_LDAP_2_BIND_DN.help_text: DN (Distinguished Name) of user to bind for all search queries. This is the system user account we will use to login to query LDAP for other user information. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for example syntax.

AUTH_LDAP_2_BIND_PASSWORD.label: LDAP Bind Password
AUTH_LDAP_2_BIND_PASSWORD.help_text: Password used to bind LDAP user account.

AUTH_LDAP_2_START_TLS.label: LDAP Start TLS
AUTH_LDAP_2_START_TLS.help_text: Whether to enable TLS when the LDAP connection is not using SSL.

AUTH_LDAP_2_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.label: LDAP Connection Options
AUTH_LDAP_2_CONNECTION_OPTIONS.help_text: Additional options to set for the LDAP connection.  LDAP referrals are disabled by default (to prevent certain LDAP queries from hanging with AD). Option names should be strings (e.g. "OPT_REFERRALS"). Refer to https://www.python-ldap.org/doc/html/ldap.html#options for possible options and values that can be set.

AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_SEARCH.label: LDAP User Search
AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_SEARCH.help_text: LDAP search query to find users.  Any user that matches the given pattern will be able to login to Tower.  The user should also be mapped into a Tower organization (as defined in the AUTH_LDAP_ORGANIZATION_MAP setting).  If multiple search queries need to be supported use of "LDAPUnion" is possible. See Tower documentation for details.

AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.label: LDAP User DN Template
AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_DN_TEMPLATE.help_text: Alternative to user search, if user DNs are all of the same format. This approach is more efficient for user lookups than searching if it is usable in your organizational environment. If this setting has a value it will be used instead of AUTH_LDAP_USER_SEARCH.

AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_ATTR_MAP.label: LDAP User Attribute Map
AUTH_LDAP_2_USER_ATTR_MAP.help_text: Mapping of LDAP user schema to Tower API user attributes. The default setting is valid for ActiveDirectory but users with other LDAP configurations may need to change the values. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for additional details.

AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_SEARCH.label: LDAP Group Search
AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_SEARCH.help_text: Users are mapped to organizations based on their membership in LDAP groups. This setting defines the LDAP search query to find groups. Unlike the user search, group search does not support LDAPSearchUnion.

AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_TYPE.label: LDAP Group Type
AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_TYPE.help_text: The group type may need to be changed based on the type of the LDAP server.  Values are listed at: https://django-auth-ldap.readthedocs.io/en/stable/groups.html#types-of-groups

AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.label: LDAP Group Type Parameters
AUTH_LDAP_2_GROUP_TYPE_PARAMS.help_text: Key value parameters to send the chosen group type init method.

AUTH_LDAP_2_REQUIRE_GROUP.label: LDAP Require Group

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SUPPORT_CONTACT.help_text: Provide the name and email address of the support contact for your service provider. Refer to the Ansible Tower documentation for example syntax.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ENABLED_IDPS.label: SAML Enabled Identity Providers
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ENABLED_IDPS.help_text: Configure the Entity ID, SSO URL and certificate for each identity provider (IdP) in use. Multiple SAML IdPs are supported. Some IdPs may provide user data using attribute names that differ from the default OIDs. Attribute names may be overridden for each IdP. Refer to the Ansible documentation for additional details and syntax.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SECURITY_CONFIG.label: SAML Security Config
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SECURITY_CONFIG.help_text: A dict of key value pairs that are passed to the underlying python-saml security setting https://github.com/onelogin/python-saml#settings

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SP_EXTRA.label: SAML Service Provider extra configuration data
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_SP_EXTRA.help_text: A dict of key value pairs to be passed to the underlying python-saml Service Provider configuration setting.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_EXTRA_DATA.label: SAML IDP to extra_data attribute mapping
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_EXTRA_DATA.help_text: A list of tuples that maps IDP attributes to extra_attributes. Each attribute will be a list of values, even if only 1 value.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ORGANIZATION_MAP.label: SAML Organization Map
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ORGANIZATION_MAP.help_text:
Mapping to organization admins/users from social auth accounts. This setting
controls which users are placed into which Tower organizations based on their
username and email address. Configuration details are available in the Ansible
Tower documentation.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_TEAM_MAP.label: SAML Team Map
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_TEAM_MAP.help_text:
Mapping of team members (users) from social auth accounts. Configuration
details are available in Tower documentation.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ORGANIZATION_ATTR.label: SAML Organization Attribute Mapping
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_ORGANIZATION_ATTR.help_text: Used to translate user organization membership into Tower.

SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_TEAM_ATTR.label: SAML Team Attribute Mapping
SOCIAL_AUTH_SAML_TEAM_ATTR.help_text: Used to translate user team membership into Tower.
